column5: I was just looking at the mustad scandinavian open page and it looks pretty fun. But I'm not going to fly to Norway just to tie some flies, so I was thinking about hosting one around here. I know there's a pretty healthy population of fly fishers in Ontario and I'm trying to get a feel for what kind of a crowd it could draw. There would be 6 categories, streamers, nymphs, dries, most accurate, a mystery fly, and classic/decorative salmon flies. Flies would be judged on symmetry, cleanliness, creativity and accuracy (when compared to the real thing). If enough people are interested I think we could do it around September? Anyways, just getting a feel. Thanks!

I am watching a fly fishing show right now.  And they are using a fly called the "Cats A$$ Mudder".  I want to see someone tie one of those..   Edit...  Auto spell check...  Exchange "meow" for the alternate term for Donkey....
Haha, we could have a viewing area?
l am getting better at tying l am in. Even if its to show what l am doing or my own variation of.
Good idea, we could videotape all the entries being tied and then sell a DVD of all the patterns at the end
Why not showcase your tying skills rite here? Lets see some pics. Wooly buggers would be a good start.
LOL, don't worry you'll have them this week.  I just thought it would be fun for everyone interested in fly fishing to come out, learn and meet some other like minded individuals
I would definitely be interested, great idea!

Looks like we have some interest  Any ideas on location? We'd want something pretty affordable, like a library or gym maybe, would also need some tables and needs to be someplace relatively easily accessible to people from the GTA and Niagara.
